meanings.definition: relating to a manor or its lord
meanings.sent1: The manorial estate had beautiful gardens that pleased the lord.
meanings.sent2: The manorial house was grand and imposing, reflecting the status of its owner.
meanings.sent3: The manorial cat thought it ruled over the entire estate, demanding treats from everyone.
meanings.sent4: The manorial presence of the lord loomed over the villagers like a protective shadow.
meanings.sent5: The manorial atmosphere was filled with the scent of freshly baked bread, welcoming all who entered.

meanings.definition: of or relating to the manor system
meanings.sent1: The manorial duties included tending to the fields and livestock.
meanings.sent2: The manorial system ensured that each serf had a specific role to play in the community.
meanings.sent3: The manorial chickens organized themselves into a union to negotiate better feed quality.
meanings.sent4: The manorial structure of the system provided stability and order in the village.
meanings.sent5: The manorial rules dictated when and where the harvest festival would take place each year.

meanings.sent1: The manorial architecture featured intricate designs and sturdy walls.
meanings.sent2: The manorial landscape was dotted with grazing sheep and grazing cows.
meanings.sent3: The manorial trees whispered secrets to each other in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent4: The manorial charm of the manor attracted visitors from far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The manorial gates creaked open, welcoming guests to the elegant estate.
